title: Christophe Gleizes: The life on hold of a French journalist imprisoned in Algeria
subhead: Aged 36, Christophe Gleizes has been held in Tizi Ouzou for more than five months. Arrested in Kabylie while reporting on a football club, he was sentenced in June to seven years in prison for 'glorifying terrorism.' His appeal trial opens on December 3.

title: Rare Fabergé 'Winter Egg' sells for record-breaking $30.2 million
subhead: Crafted for Russia's imperial family in 1913, this crystal and diamond egg was described as 'the Mona Lisa for decorative arts' before it sold at auction in London on Tuesday.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio and Paul Thomas Anderson: Two Hollywood stars in Paris after the battle
subhead: Absent during the European promotion of the film 'One Battle After Another,' the American actor and director reunited in France to talk about Hollywood and their 30-year friendship.

subhead: After the murder of Mehdi Kessaci, the brother of an activist against drug trafficking, Le Monde spoke with residents of housing projects, social workers, judges and police officers. They described a growing sense of powerlessness and danger.

title: Gay Talese, the last titan of the American press
subhead: He was a pioneer of New Journalism, a movement that transformed American journalism with a literary writing style. At 93, the author of the landmark 1966 profile 'Frank Sinatra Has a Cold,' finds his daily life increasingly constrained by old age.

title: The art of being Oscar Wilde's grandson
subhead: As Ireland prepares to mark the 125th anniversary of Oscar Wilde's death, Merlin Holland, his only living descendant, works in France to protect the memory of a man who was long viewed as scandalous.
